video.title: Star Trek
video.synopsis: Led by unflappable Capt. Kirk, the crew of the starship Enterprise delves deep into the far reaches of space to explore new worlds and civilizations.

episodes.synopsis: Capt. Pike is held prisoner and tested by aliens who have the power to project incredibly lifelike illusions.
episodes.title: Pilot: The Cage

episodes.synopsis: The crew is stalked by a shape-shifting creature that drains the salt from humans. When it is unintentionally brought aboard, Scotty faces a decision.
episodes.title: The Man Trap

episodes.synopsis: Powerful teenage psychic Charlie beams aboard. Although wanting to be liked, he attacks others until the secret of his powers are revealed to Kirk.
episodes.title: Charlie X

episodes.synopsis: As Kirk and Spock investigate a Starfleet tragedy, a friend of Kirk becomes endowed with godlike powers. To stop him, Kirk must hatch a risky plan.
episodes.title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

episodes.synopsis: A virus causes the Enterprise crew to lose all self-control, as Sulu threatens the crew with a sword, Spock cries and Bones looks for an antidote.
episodes.title: The Naked Time

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise transporter malfunctions and beams Kirk onboard with his evil doppelganger. Scotty saves Kirk and his crew stranded on a frigid planet.
episodes.title: The Enemy Within

episodes.synopsis: Kirk and the crew rescue Harry Mudd and three "mail-order brides" from his matchmaking service. Mudd tries to stop Kirk from bringing him to justice.
episodes.title: Mudd's Women

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise's search for famous scientist Roger leads Kirk to a deserted planet where Roger, who lives with two lifelike androids, turns on Kirk.
episodes.title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise arrives at a planet where a virus puts humans in a chronic childlike state. When Kirk and his team become victims, only Bones can help.
episodes.title: Miri

episodes.synopsis: A deranged doctor escapes to the Enterprise from a planetary penal colony. As Kirk investigates, he is brainwashed by the colony's maniacal director.
episodes.title: Dagger of the Mind

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise narrowly escapes from imposing alien Balok's starship, but when Balok transmits a distress call, Kirk and the crew go to his aid.
episodes.title: The Corbomite Maneuver

episodes.synopsis: Spock abducts the Enterprise's injured former captain and sets a course for a forbidden planet. Facing a court-martial, Spock refuses to back down.
episodes.title: The Menagerie: Part 1

episodes.synopsis: During Spock's court-martial, video images of Capt. Pike's encounter with the psychic Talosians reveal Spock's motivation for hijacking the ship.
episodes.title: The Menagerie: Part 2

episodes.synopsis: Kodos, a fugitive mass murderer, is a 23rd-century Shakespearean actor. When a friend is murdered, Kirk asks a Shakespearean troupe to investigate.
episodes.title: The Conscience of the King

episodes.synopsis: After Romulan war birds destroy Federation outposts, the Enterprise pursues them. Similarities between them and Vulcans spark bigotry against Spock.
episodes.title: Balance of Terror

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise lands at a picturesque planet for shore leave, but the idyll is ruined when a Samurai and a bloodthirsty knight attack Sulu and Bones.
episodes.title: Shore Leave

episodes.synopsis: Spock, Bones, Scotty and others crash-land on a planet where they're attacked by deadly giants. Spock risks their lives on a slim chance at a rescue.
episodes.title: The Galileo Seven

episodes.synopsis: On a planet where Trelane, a childish alien fascinated by Napoleon, rules with godlike power, the Enterprise is captured. Kirk offers his life for it.
episodes.title: The Squire of Gothos

episodes.synopsis: Aliens abduct Kirk and a Gorn, a violent, lizard-like humanoid. To save their crews, Kirk and the Gorn must fight to the death, but Kirk refuses.
episodes.title: Arena

episodes.synopsis: A black star sends the Enterprise back in time to 1960s Earth. Before they can turn back, Kirk and the crew must destroy all evidence of their visit.
episodes.title: Tomorrow Is Yesterday

episodes.synopsis: After an officer is killed in a freak accident, computer records indicate Kirk is to blame.  Evidence at a court-martial reveal that Kirk was framed.
episodes.title: Court Martial

episodes.synopsis: When the Enterprise travels to a planet where a Starfleet ship disappeared years ago, they find a tyrannical computer who rules its oppressed people.
episodes.title: The Return of the Archons

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise encounters brutal super humans led by Khan Noonien Singh, who battles Kirk for control, turning a trusted colleague against Starfleet.
episodes.title: Space Seed

episodes.synopsis: Arriving at a planet where his crew are slated to die, Kirk learns they're in a virtual war in which people must commit suicide to avoid real combat.
episodes.title: A Taste of Armageddon

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise lands on a planet where spores cause everyone to become very passive and affectionate toward one another. Kirk soon learns the secret.
episodes.title: This Side of Paradise

episodes.synopsis: When a monster kills several men at a mining colony, Kirk and Spock investigate. Spock learns the odd creature is intelligent, with a valid motive.
episodes.title: The Devil in the Dark

episodes.synopsis: Kirk tries to establish an outpost on a planet inhabited by seemingly primitive Organians.  When Klingons attack, Organians show their true evolution.
episodes.title: Errand of Mercy

episodes.synopsis: Kirk meets Lazarus, who claims he's chasing his parallel self through space and time and if Kirk doesn't help him, the entire multiverse is at risk.
episodes.title: The Alternative Factor

episodes.synopsis: Bones travels back to 1930s America and inadvertently destroys the future. To reverse the damage, Kirk and Spock also go back, and Kirk falls in love.
episodes.title: The City on the Edge of Forever

episodes.synopsis: On another planet, Kirk's brother is killed by amoeba like aliens that also infect Spock. Bones tries to cure Spock with light, but causes blindness.
episodes.title: Operation: Annihilate!

episodes.synopsis: In the throes of his Pon Farr mating period, Spock must return to Vulcan to meet his intended future wife, betrothed from childhood.
episodes.title: Amok Time

episodes.synopsis: A powerful being claiming to be the Greek god Apollo appears and demands that the crew disembark onto his planet to worship him.
episodes.title: Who Mourns for Adonais?

episodes.synopsis: An artificially intelligent probe with a murderously twisted imperative comes on to the Enterprise and confuses Capt. Kirk with his creator.
episodes.title: The Changeling

episodes.synopsis: Kirk, McCoy, Scotty and Uhura find themselves in a mirror universe aboard a parallel Enterprise run by ruthless barbarians.
episodes.title: Mirror, Mirror

episodes.synopsis: Kirk and a landing party beam down to what seems to be an ideal, Eden-like planet.
episodes.title: The Apple

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise encounters the wrecked Constellation, whose distraught captain is determined to stop the giant ship that killed his crew.
episodes.title: The Doomsday Machine

episodes.synopsis: When Kirk and his landing party arrive on the planet below, they are met with eerie mists, a dark castle, witches, goblins and a black cat.
episodes.title: Catspaw

episodes.synopsis: Harry Mudd returns with a plot to take over the Enterprise by stranding the crew on a planet populated by androids under his command.
episodes.title: I, Mudd

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise encounters a mysterious energy cloud that pulls them down to planet Gamma Canaris N, where they meet a castaway.
episodes.title: Metamorphosis

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise hosts a number of quarrelling diplomats -- including Spock's father -- but someone on board has murder in mind.
episodes.title: Journey to Babel

episodes.synopsis: The Federation is in competition with the Klingons for an alliance with the inhabitants of Capella IV, a warrior tribe.
episodes.title: Friday's Child

episodes.synopsis: A landing party from the Enterprise is exposed to strange form of radiation that rapidly ages them.
episodes.title: The Deadly Years

episodes.synopsis: Capt. Kirk obsessively hunts for a mysterious cloud creature he encountered in his youth.
episodes.title: Obsession

episodes.synopsis: Scotty is suspected of murdering a belly dancer.
episodes.title: Wolf in the Fold

episodes.synopsis: Kirk must deal with Federation bureaucrats, a Klingon battle cruiser and a peddler who sells furry, purring, hungry little creatures as pets.
episodes.title: The Trouble with Tribbles

episodes.synopsis: Kirk, Uhura and Chekhov are trapped on a planet where gladiators are enslaved and trained to perform for the amusement of bored, faceless aliens.
episodes.title: The Gamesters of Triskelion

episodes.synopsis: Kirk, Spock and McCoy beam down and find themselves in a culture similar to Earth gangs of the 1920s.
episodes.title: A Piece of the Action

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise encounters a gigantic, energy-draining space organism that threatens the galaxy.
episodes.title: The Immunity Syndrome

episodes.synopsis: Kirk returns to the planet Neural, where he spent time 13 years earlier. A friend of Kirk's from his previous visit is now the leader of its people.
episodes.title: A Private Little War

episodes.synopsis: The last three members of an ancient race far more advanced than humans wish to borrow the bodies of Kirk, Spock and Dr. Mulhall.
episodes.title: Return to Tomorrow

episodes.synopsis: Looking for a missing Federation cultural observer, Kirk and Spock find themselves on a planet whose culture is modeled on the Nazi Party.
episodes.title: Patterns of Force

episodes.synopsis: Kirk, Spock, McCoy and a couple of red shirts beam down to the surface of a planet in answer to a fake distress call.
episodes.title: By Any Other Name

episodes.synopsis: Kirk finds Capt. Tracey of the USS Exeter violating the prime directive and interfering with a war between the Yangs and the Kohms.
episodes.title: The Omega Glory

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise is chosen to be the test ship for the new M-5 multitronic computer system, which is designed to run a ship without human help.
episodes.title: The Ultimate Computer

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise discovers a planet whose oppressive government is a 20th-century version of Earth's Roman Empire.
episodes.title: Bread and Circuses

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise is assigned to observe Earth's history in 1968.
episodes.title: Assignment: Earth

episodes.synopsis: When a mysterious intruder on the "Enterprise" cunningly steals Spock's brain, Bones tries to keep the Vulcan alive while Kirk tracks down the thief.
episodes.title: Spock's Brain

episodes.synopsis: On Kirk's orders, the Enterprise deliberately crosses the Neutral Zone into Romulan space and is promptly surrounded by Romulan warships.
episodes.title: The Enterprise Incident

episodes.synopsis: Trapped on a planet whose inhabitants resemble American Indians, Kirk loses his memory and is proclaimed a God.
episodes.title: The Paradise Syndrome

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise reaches a Federation colony where the adults have all killed each other but the children play without care.
episodes.title: And the Children Shall Lead

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise transports the Medusan ambassador Kollos; his telepathic interpreter, Dr. Miranda Jones; and engineer Laurence Marvick.
episodes.title: Is There In Truth No Beauty?

episodes.synopsis: As punishment for trespassing on their planet, the inhabitants condemn Capt. Kirk and his landing party to reenact the Gunfight at the O.K. Corral.
episodes.title: Spectre of the Gun

episodes.synopsis: An entity traps the Enterprise crew and the crew of a disabled Klingon battle cruiser in an unending war aboard the Enterprise.
episodes.title: Day of the Dove

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise discovers that an apparent asteroid on a collision course with a planet is actually an ancient populated generation ship.
episodes.title: For the World Is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky

episodes.synopsis: Kirk and the derelict starship Defiant vanish into a spatial interphase between universes.
episodes.title: The Tholian Web

episodes.synopsis: On an urgent medical emergency, Kirk, Spock and McCoy encounter an alien society that had once flourished on Earth during the time of Plato.
episodes.title: Plato's Stepchildren

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise responds to a distress call from the planet Scalos, but when a landing party beams down, they find no living beings.
episodes.title: Wink of an Eye

episodes.synopsis: Trapped in an alien laboratory, Kirk, Spock and McCoy meet an empath and are involved in a series of experiments.
episodes.title: The Empath

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise transports Elaan, a member of the ruling dynasty of the warrior Elasians, to the planet of their enemy, the Troyians.
episodes.title: Elaan of Troyius

episodes.synopsis: Kirk and Spock are taken prisoner by a former starship captain who now resides at -- and has taken over -- an asylum for the criminally insane.
episodes.title: Whom Gods Destroy

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise encounters two duo-chromatic and mutually belligerent aliens who put the ship in the middle of their old conflict.
episodes.title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield

episodes.synopsis: Kirk beams down to the planet Gideon and appears to find himself trapped on the deserted Enterprise.
episodes.title: The Mark of Gideon

episodes.synopsis: After the Enterprise landing party beams down to investigate a geologically interesting planet, their ship is hurled across the galaxy.
episodes.title: That Which Survives

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise is on course to install new equipment on Memory Alpha, the central library storage facility for the Federation.
episodes.title: The Lights of Zetar

episodes.synopsis: Kirk, Spock and McCoy beam down to a supposedly uninhabited planet to gather the mineral ryetalyn to fight a plague of Rigelian fever.
episodes.title: Requiem for Methuselah

episodes.synopsis: The Enterprise is ordered to pursue a group of antiestablishment idealists who have stolen a space cruiser.
episodes.title: The Way to Eden

episodes.synopsis: Kirk and Spock are caught up in a revolution on a planet where intellectuals and artists live in a utopian city in the sky.
episodes.title: The Cloud Minders

episodes.synopsis: Kirk, Spock, Abraham Lincoln and Surak are pitted in battle against four notorious villains from history.
episodes.title: The Savage Curtain

episodes.synopsis: The planet Sarpeidon is about to be destroyed by its star, Beta Niobe, becoming a supernova.
episodes.title: All Our Yesterdays

episodes.synopsis: Kirk is confronted with the deep hatred of an old love, Janice Lester, who is severely ill from celebium radiation.
episodes.title: Turnabout Intruder
